org.xlattice.crypto.digest

Class SHA1

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.crypto.digest.SHA1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Digest

    public class SHA1
extends java.lang.Object
implements Digest
    Secure Hash Algorithm, as modified in FIPS 180-1, 17 April 1995, to become SHA-1. SHA1 is one of many similar algorithms. Padding at least should be split out, as it is much the same with many of them. XXX Need to review when to throw CryptoException.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Method Detail

      • _expand

        protected final void _expand(byte[] msg,
           int offset)
        Expand byte[64]/int32[16]/512 bit block to int32[80]. No check is made on the size of the block, but it must be 64 bytes long, and the usual padding (1, zeroes, then int64 length bringing it to a 512-bit boundary) must have been added, unless of course you are writing a paper for a conference. The final rotation by one bit is what distinguishes SHA1 from SHA0.
        Parameters:
        msg - message being hashed
        offset - beginning of the block in the message byte array

      • _f0

      • _cycle

        protected final void _cycle(byte[] msg,
          int offset,
          int stopAt,
          boolean pretty)
        SHA's 80-step cycle, unoptimized. Useful for exercises like the Shandong tests, where results for so many subrounds are of interest. Shandong paper has a collision at subround 57 (58, one-based). No checks on input are performed.
        Parameters:
        msg - buffer holding data to be compressed
        offset - of first byte to be processed
        stopAt - last SHA subround
        pretty - whether to pretty-print results

      • _fastCycle

        protected final void _fastCycle(byte[] msg,
              int offset)
        SHA's 80-step cycle unrolled. There are no checks on input.
        Parameters:
        msg - buffer holding data to be compressed
        offset - of first byte to be processed

      • padAndAddLength

        protected final void padAndAddLength(int bytesLastBlock)
        Zero fill the buffer, put in the length, and run it through the mill. The 0x80 byte must have already been added. There is no check on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        bytesLastBlock - bytes in the last block processed

      • padAndUpdate

        protected final void padAndUpdate()
        There is not enough room for the length left in the block (it's over 56 bytes long), so just zero fill and run it through. We will put the length in a final block..

      • intResult

        public final int[] intResult()
        Returns the result of an 80-step round without adding the initial hash, h0; in the form of an int array.
        Returns:
        the digest as an int array

      • prettyPrint

        protected static void prettyPrint(int i,
               int v,
               int w,
               int x,
               int y,
               int z)
        Display a (subround) number followed by a hex representation of five integer values. Useful for pretty-printing A, B, C, D, E at the end of a subround.
